docs.text: Home Library intended for rapid prototyping in embedded devices with support of standard interfaces such as USB, UART and RS485. It supports addressing for interfaces where it makes sense and tries to be as modular and easily extensible as possible.
docs.title: Home

docs.text: Library intended for rapid prototyping in embedded devices with support of standard interfaces such as USB, UART and RS485. It supports addressing for interfaces where it makes sense and tries to be as modular and easily extensible as possible.
docs.title: Home

docs.text: Install mkdocs if you haven't already, here are the instructions. For full documentation visit mkdocs.org . View Docs locally Run mkdocs serve from the root project directory, this starts up a local server to which you can connect using your browser, usually at http://127.0.0.1:8000/ . The server watches for changes and automatically refreshes the site. There is no need to use the mkdocs build , this creates all the html files needed for deployment and we use a different method for that.
docs.title: Using MkDocs
